channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: Australian performance funding, a technical note of the technical note
item.description: Last week the Australian Department of Education, Skills and Employment (DESE) released a technical note on the performance based funding scheme.

item.title: How would rankings from an Australian PBF compare to other conventional rankings?
item.description: Australian performance based funding In a report last year on performance based funding alongside my co-authors Andrew Harvey and Matt Brett, we raised the point that the TEF in the UK could disrupt conventional higher education rankings such as the THE or QS. In part this depends on how salient the ranking is on those that make decisions that could be considered competitive, ie potential students. Holding that constant, we found the TEF at the very least did nominally dislodge some of the prevailing hierarchies.

item.title: Reflections on the role of data science in the Australian university
item.description: Australian universities are some of the largest in the world if measured by student numbers. We have 39 universities, the average size of which is over 35 thousand students. At the university I work at we have over 38,000 students, undertaking close to 400 courses, and over 3000 unique subjects. The university gathers data on student enrolments, learning management system (LMS) activity, class scheduling data, and the data gathered from the array of Quality Indicators of Learning and Teaching (QILT) surveys.

item.title: About me
item.description: Beni Cakitaki Senior Researcher at the Centre for Higher Education Equity & Diversity Research (CHEEDR) at La Trobe University Quantitative researcher at CHEEDR, La Trobe University. Intellectual interests are broad, but include higher education equity, policy, statistics, R, causal inference, Australian history, history of economic thought, unions and collective action, labour markets, and the study of social, and economic inequality. Otherwise, I love AFL footy - Western Bulldogs, Taika Waititi films, Stormzy, Elton John, and the All Blacks.
